result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam K. Wilund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, 

AODA and Follow up, 

DNA Sample
Maintain Full time/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week,

Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, 

No Contact with any Pick and Save or Lambs Fresh Market Stores,

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam K. Wilund

22CM945:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500)>> NO CONTEST.

Defendant makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
22CM784:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, AODA and Follow up, Maintain Full time/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with any Pick and Save or Lambs Fresh Market Stores, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 0 Days Credit.

Court finds 0 Days Credit.
